p: Monoterpenes are the main components in leaf extracts in many members of the genus Cinnamomum, such as C. osmophloeum [ 43], C. burmannii [ 44] and C. kanehirae Hay [ 45]. In this study, 24 components were identified in borneol and linalool-chemotypes of C. camphora. An analysis of the components showed that the essential oil or crystal isolated from C. camphora consists primarily of monoterpenes with very minor quantities of sesquiterpenes and diterpenes. However, the most prevalent monoterpene differed between the two chemotypes, with a high content of (âˆ’)-borneol in the borneol-type and a higher content of linalool in the linalool-type than in the borneol-type. Therefore, the different major monoterpenes mainly contributed to the differences between the essential oil of the two chemotypes.
